program_title: Single Family Housing Direct Home Loans
program_description_1: This program offers mortgage financing to help eligible, low- and very-low-income applicants buy, build, improve, or repair a rural home as their primary residence.
program_description_2: The Single Family Housing Direct Loan Program also provides payment assistance – a temporary subsidy – to help increase a borrower's repayment ability.
applicant_requirement_2: Be unable to get a loan with reasonable terms and conditions from other resources
applicant_requirement_3: Agree to live in the home as your primary residence
applicant_requirement_4: Meet U.S. citizenship or noncitizen requirements
property_requirement_1: Be considered modest for the area
property_requirement_2: Not have a market value higher than the area loan limit
payment_assistance_repayment_condition: Must repay all or part of any payment assistance received over the life of the loan when property title transfers or you no longer live in the dwelling.
maximum_loan_amount_factors: income, assets, debts, and the amount of payment assistance for which you are eligible
interest_rates_basis: current market rates at loan approval or closing, whichever is lower
application_process: Applications are accepted year-round through your local USDA Rural Development office.
program_handbook_title: The Single Family Housing Direct Program Field Office Handbook
applicant_income_criteria: adjusted income must be at or below the low-income limit for the area
property_location_criteria: must be located in an eligible rural area
qr_code_description: SFH Direct Home Loan Program webpage
note_consult_official_instructions: Because information changes, always consult official program instructions or contact your local Rural Development office for help.
note_equal_opportunity_statement: USDA is an equal opportunity provider, employer, and lender.
